alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Caroline; Cumberland; Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Louisa, eastern Cumberland, northwestern Nottoway, Goochland, Hanover, Powhatan, northwestern Chesterfield, east central Prince Edward, Caroline, northwestern Henrico, Amelia and southeastern Fluvanna Counties and the City of Richmond through 230 PM EDT... At 136 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mineral to near Jetersville. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Louisa and Mineral around 140 PM EDT. Chula around 155 PM EDT. Moseley around 205 PM EDT. Manakin and Sabot around 220 PM EDT. Bon Air and Tuckahoe around 225 PM EDT. Richmond, University Of Richmond, Virginia Union University, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Lakeside, Laurel, East Highland Park and Glen Allen around 230 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chilesburg, Orchid, Angola, Maidens, Gum Tree, Three Square, Skinquarter, Chamberlayne, Whiteville and Fine Creek Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and north central Virginia.
